CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: .50 Beowulf FMJ
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Standard .50 Beowulf Full Metal Jacket, jack in all trade, master of none

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: .50 Beowulf API
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: .50 Beowulf Armor Piercing Incendiary ammo, good counter medium armored target

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: .50 Beowulf HP
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: .50 Beowulf Hollow Point ammo, good counter light or non-armored target

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: .50 Beowulf EMP
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: .50 Beowulf ElectroMagnetic Pulse ammo, can stun/paralize machine and cause electric burn

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: 8x57mm Patrone 88 (FMJ)
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: First generation smokeless propellant cartridge, doesn't has the best ballistic compared to modern catridge, but is lot better than slow speed catridge made with black gun powder.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: 7.92x57mm S Patrone (FMJ)
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Improve version of the Patrone 88 and the catridge became the official adoption to the army, improved in ballistic, weight, stopping power, accuracy and effective range, basically everything.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: 7.92x57mm K Patrone (AP)
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Aka. S.m.K.H.(Spitzgeschoss mit Kern, Hart), Spitzer bullet/Heavy pointed with hardened core, it use Tungsten to increase its effectiveness as penetration projectile.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: 7.92x57mm B Patrone (HE-T)
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: B(Beobachtung)/High Explosive - Tracer, an "Observation" bullet for Luftwaffen and sharpshooters, the bullet explode after impact to indicate where it landed for the shooter, can cause temporal concussion and blast damage when hit at soft target.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: 7.92x33mm K (FMJ)
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Full Metal Jacket, more powerful than pistol round but weaker than rifle round, relatively cheap to produce.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: 7.92x33mm K (AP)
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Armor Piercing round, use hardened Tungsten core bullet and increased projectile speed to increase its armor penetration.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: 7.92x33mm K (J)
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Jaggerpatrone 43, overcharge sharpshooter round, increase its overall performance.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: 7.63x25mm Mauser (FMJ)
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Full Metal Jacket, high velocity bullet, doesn't have as much stopping power as most of the pistol caliber but thanks to its projectile velocity, it has better penetration than most pistol's FMJ round.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: 7.63x25mm Mauser (HP)
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Hollow Point, custom bullet, increased stopping power the trade off is reducing the penetration and slightly the projectile velocity.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: 13.2x92mm SR TuF (AP)
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: The Mauser 13.2mm TuF (German: Tank und Flieger; lit. "tank and aircraft", known also as 13.2Ã—92mmSR) cartridge, was a major step in the development of anti-tank cartridges, being the first one designed for the sole purpose of destroying armored targets.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: 13.2x92mm SR TuF (APHE)
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Due the catridge became obsolete after the war, the surplus ammo are filled with small amount explosive payload to increase its damage counter light armored vehicle and soft target, the modification reduce its penetration capability quite bit.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: 13x64mmB (HE-T)
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: High Explosive - Tracer round, generally used for AA purpose, due its increased explosive payload for the bullets, is very effective counter light armored and soft target, but it reduce a lots of its penetration for exchange.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: 10 Gauge Buckshot
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Filled with several buckshot pellets which spread in a tight pattern, bigger pellets than 12 Gauges Buckshot, but with less pellets due increase pellet size.
